snippet: Mark K. Levitan, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s director of poverty research, changed the way the city counts its needy, bringing millions out of the statistical shadows.
abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column on Michael R Bloomberg's director of poverty research Mark K Levitan, who changed way New York City counts its needy, bringing millions out of statistical shadows; Levitan's statistical methodology, based on recommendations from the National Academy of Science, has more than doubled the percentage of New Yorkers categorized as poor.
lead_paragraph: Mark K. Levitan, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s director of poverty research, changed the way the city counts its needy, bringing millions out of the statistical shadows.

headline.main: With New Formula, an Official Helped Unmask the Face of Poverty in New York
headline.print_headline: With New Formula, Unmasking the Face of Poverty in New York
